ai-tha-ap69:2.2_0: to whom he gave him his name.
ai-tha-ap69:2.3_0: A gift one gives to me,
ai-tha-ap69:2.4_0: the poised one, the perfected one;
ai-tha-ap69:3.2_0: the Buddha, the ruler of the world,
ai-tha-ap69:3.3_0: The Teacher standing in the sky,
ai-tha-ap69:4.1_0: ‘By this cloth there is this cloth,
ai-tha-ap69:4.3_0: Having given up a heavy burden,
ai-tha-ap69:4.4_0: will delight in the world of the gods.’
ai-tha-ap69:5.2_0: for the sake of the world’s enjoying the benefit of the world.
ai-tha-ap69:6.4_0: as the cloth is the fruit.
ai-tha-ap69:7.1_0: Seven people are free from oppression,
ai-tha-ap69:9.1_0: That is how these verses were recited by the senior venerable Bhaddiya.
ai-tha-ap69:10.1_0: The seventh section on the forty-thousand Elders
